context: The word 'sõi' is the past tense (simple past) form of the Estonian verb 'sööma', which means 'to eat'. In this form, it would translate to 'ate' in English. It indicates that the action of eating was completed in the past. The infinitive form is 'sööma' and the present tense forms include ' söön (I eat), sööd (you eat), sööb (he/she/it eats)', etc.
